question: to whom do the powers not given to the federal government by the constitution go
api_result: According to the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution, the powers not delegated to the federal government by the Constitution, nor prohibited by it to the states, are reserved to the states respectively, or to the people. This amendment is part of the Bill of Rights and was ratified on December 15, 1791. It essentially supports the principle of federalism by providing that powers not granted to the federal government nor denied to the states by the Constitution are reserved to the states or the people.
